annotations.text: There is a 4 year grace period for the payment of land rent; Rent from the first 4 years of the contract will be prorated over the remaining years annually starting from the date of execution of the contract; Thereafter the annual amount payable will be birr 2,997,000 (or birr 111 per hectare) and the total amount payable under the agreement will be birr 74,925,000; There is to be a 1-year down payment

annotations.text: BHO is to start developing the land within 6 months from the date of execution of the contract or from the date that BHO receives final clearance from the Ethiopian government, whichever is later; BHO must develop 1/3 of the leased land within 1 year; BHO shall not make any unauthorized use of the leased land beyond the predetermined purpose, objective or plan as stated in Art. 3 without the express written consent of the Ministry

BHO has the right to build infrastructure such as dams, water boreholes, power houses, irrigation systems, roads, bridges, office, residential buildings, fuel/power supply stations/ outlets health/ hospitals/ dispensaries and education facilities upon consultation with, and submission of a request for a permit to, the relevant government offices

annotations.text: Both parties are to do their utmost to resolve any dispute amicably; If they are unable to do so, the dispute is to be referred to Ethiopian Federal Court
Upon developing 75% of the land, BHO can transfer the land or properties developed on the land to a third party with the prior consent of the Ministry

The contract may be terminated: (a) upon expiry of the lease period or other extended period as agreed by the parties; (b) upon the Ministry's failure to deliver the land to BHO for a reason other than a force majeure; (c) upon either party's failure to remedy a breach of their obligations within 6 months of receiving written notice from the other party to do so; (d) upon BHO's failure to settle annual rental payments for 2 consecutive years; and (e) upon 6 months' advance notice by either party to terminate the agreement

Where the contract is terminated by BHO for breach by the Ministry of its obligations or covenants under the contract, the Ministry shall pay BHO the value of improvements made by BHO on the land; If the agreement is terminated by the Ministry because of a breach by BHO, it is not required to make a payment to BHO
